game.layout.layout¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Layout

Layout to keep order over the components and select them with the arrows.

Attributes¶

list

class game.layout.layout.Layout(dimensions: tuple, objList: None | list = None, start: tuple = (1, 1), fillerValue: Any = None)¶

Layout to keep order over the components and select them with the arrows.

setValue(obj: object, pos: tuple) → None¶

Sets the object in a position of the layout.

NOTE: The first object in the layout has pos (1, 1).

Args:

obj (object): Object to set in, should inherit from ComponentFormat. pos (tuple): Position to place.

Raises:

IndexError: The position can not be 0.

updateSelected(newPos: tuple) → object¶

Selects the position and deselects that last selection.

Args:

newPos (tuple): The position of the new object to be selected.

Returns:

object: Returns the new selected object.

doAction(**kwargs) → None¶

Does the action() of the current position.

updatePos(newPos: tuple) → None¶

Moves to a new position and selects that position.

Args:

newPos (tuple): New position to move to.

Raises:

IndexError: If the new pos is out of range on x. IndexError: If the new pos is out of range on y.

getPos() → list[int]¶

Returns the position.

Returns:

list: First the x pos and then the y pos.

__str__() → str¶

Retruns the string form of the object.

Returns:

str: Values from the layout.

game.layout.layout.list = [['heisann', [2, 2]], ['hvordan gar dagen din da', [1, 1]], ['haper den gar bra :)', [4, 4]]]¶
